item.description:
„Äê

‚úàÔ∏è #‚Äã747 ‚Äî August 1, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Observable Notebooks¬†2.0 Technology Preview ‚Äî The Observable Framework and the new Notebook Kit are just two parts of a rich ecosystem of reactive JavaScript ‚Äònotebook‚Äô-style tools for creating data visualizations (example) and dashboards, originally created by Mike Bostock. This v2 release previews a big step forward with a new notebook file format based on HTML and, for the first time, support for true vanilla JavaScript, complete with the ability to import libraries with import. Here‚Äôs another neat example showing off the¬†potential. There are a lot of parts here, so dig¬†in.

Observable, Inc.

CodeRabbit‚Äôs Free AI Code Reviews in IDE - VS Code, Cursor, Windsurf ‚Äî Code Rabbit brings AI code reviews to VS Code, Cursor & Windsurf. Get line-by-line reviews, one-click fixes & codebase-aware feedback - all free in your IDE. Seamlessly integrates with git workflows. Install the extension & start¬†reviewing!

CodeRabbit sponsor

The Many JavaScript Runtimes of the Last Decade ‚Äî A fantastic, well-researched look at the myriad of JavaScript runtimes and engines both past and present, from mainstream picks like Node.js and Bun, to cloud platforms and some more obscure ‚Äòhonorable mentions‚Äô. A perfect way to round out your knowledge of JavaScript‚Äôs runtime¬†story.

Whatever, Jamie

Node.js v22.18 (LTS) Gets Type Stripping by Default ‚Äî We wouldn‚Äôt normally feature a minor Node.js LTS release, but this one comes with a big tweak: type stripping/TypeScript support is enabled by default, making node app.ts a reality, much as with Bun or¬†Deno.

Antoine du Hamel

üí° Node v24.5 (Current) has also been released, with node:http(s) now supporting proxies, OpenSSL 3.5, and --experimental-wasm-modules¬†unflagged.

IN BRIEF:

  • üïπÔ∏è LLM whisperer Simon Willison shows off how he used the new GLM-4.5 Air model running locally on his MacBook Pro to implement a JavaScript 'Space Invaders' game in one shot. You can play it here.

  • npm now lets you securely publish npm packages from CI/CD workflows using OpenID Connect (OIDC) for¬†authentication.

  • üìä The Stack Overflow 2025 survey results are out, and JavaScript sits at #1 in the most used languages, React holds the top frontend library spot, with jQuery at number¬†two.

  • Tailwind Plus has added support for vanilla JavaScript ‚Äì no Vue or React needed.

RELEASES:

  • ‚≠ê pnpm 10.14 ‚Äì The alternative, efficient package¬†manager adds the ability to declare a Node.js, Deno or Bun version in package.json and have it installed and pinned¬†automatically.

  • Node-RED 4.1 ‚Äì Powerful JS-based low-code flow-based platform for building event-driven¬†apps.

  • Ionic 8.7 ‚Äì Cross-platform mobile app development framework.

  • Storybook 9.1 ‚Äì Frontend component and UI¬†workshop.

  • TypeScript 5.9 RC ‚Äì The final release is imminent (most likely later¬†today).

  • ESLint v9.32.0, Preact 10.27, Angular 20.1.4, Deno 2.4.3, React 19.1.1

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Zod vs. Valibot: A JS/TS Validator Battle ‚Äî You know it‚Äôs good when the creator of Zod comments: ‚Äúincredible video. honestly blown away by how succinct and clear you made everything.‚Äù (12¬†minutes.)

Jack Herrington

Compile Svelte 5 in Your Head ‚Äî Svelte does things a little differently to most UI frameworks by compiling code to components ahead-of-time, but what is it actually doing at the code¬†level?

Tan Li Hau

Choosing The Right SaaS Architecture: Multi-Tenant Vs. Single-Tenant ‚Äî Choosing between multi-tenant and single-tenant? This guide breaks down the tradeoffs¬†clearly.

Clerk sponsor

Logical Assignment Operators in JavaScript: Small Syntax, Big Wins ‚Äî A handy post if you need to get a grip on your ||=, &&= and¬†??=s.

Matt Smith

Making Sense of the Performance Extensibility API ‚Äî The Performance Extensibility API allows us to create custom tracks in Chrome DevTools‚Äô Performance panel ‚Äî here‚Äôs how to make use of¬†it.

Harry Roberts

üì∫ The Creator of Bun on Building Bun and its Node.js Compatibility Patrick Akil and Jarred Sumner

üìÑ The Multi-Repository TypeScript Problem ‚Äì Solving cross-repo type¬†safety. David Moores

üìÑ vi.mock is a Footgun: Why vi.spyOn Should Be Your Default Brendan McLoughlin

üìÑ How to Build 2D Game-Style Physics with Matter.js and React Native Skia Daniel Friyia (Expo Blog)

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Dependency Cruiser 17: A Way to Visualize Dependencies ‚Äî If you want a look at the output, there‚Äôs a whole page of graphs for popular, real world projects including Chalk, Yarn, and¬†React.

Sander Verweij

TanStack DB: The Embedded Client Database for TanStack Query ‚Äî One for team React! TanStack‚ÄØDB is an embedded client‚Äëside database that uses differential dataflow to power live, relational queries, sub‚Äëms incremental updates, and optimistic writes. This post is a great pitch, and the first beta is available¬†now.

Kyle Mathews and Sam Willis

Connect Performance and Reliability to User Engagement ‚Äî With Embrace, see where technical issues cause dropoff, along with attribute correlations to surface affected¬†cohorts.

Embrace sponsor

AudioTee.js: macOS System Audio Capture for Node.js ‚Äî Wrapping around an (included) Swift-powered binary, this captures Mac system audio output and emits it as PCM encoded chunks at regular intervals. GitHub¬†repo.

Nick Payne

  • Ghost 6.0 RC ‚Äì The popular Node.js-powered blogging / publishing platform approaches its next major¬†release.

  • Ink 6.1 ‚Äì Use React to build CLI¬†apps, as used by Claude Code, Gemini CLI, and many other apps.

  • Cytoscape.js 3.33 ‚Äì Graph theory/network visualization and analysis¬†library.

  • eslint-plugin-vue 10.4 ‚Äì Official ESLint plugin for Vue.js.¬†(Homepage.)

  • Axios 1.11 ‚Äì Long-standing, promise-based isomorphic HTTP¬†client.

  • InversifyJS 7.7 ‚Äì Lightweight inversion of control¬†container.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üîç Discover KeyLines - a scalable JavaScript graph visualization toolkit that turns complex data into actionable¬†insights.

üéÅ¬†Some Bonus Items

  • Google has unveiled a new open-licensed code font called Google Sans Code. It has a 'soft' feel to it and is inspired by Google's branding. It's available on Google Fonts too, if you want to quickly plug it into a site.

  • NPKILL is a popular tool for digging into, and cleaning up, those heavy node_modules folders you've accumulated. v1.0 is nearly here and its author is thinking about how it could be extended to cleaning up other types of clutter.

  • Pete Matsyburka demonstrates how just a few lines of code can make sites load faster, thanks to the Speculation Rules API (currently only supported by Chromium-based browsers).

  • Got a big JavaScript project that needs some serious attention from someone experienced? npm creator Isaac Z. Schlueter is available for hire.

  • üì∫ If you've never thought about what might go into making a text editor, ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†Computerphile's latest video will be an eye opener.

  • I have to admire someone who builds their blog using C preprocessor macros.

item.title: „ÄêA tricky, educational quiz: it's about time..„Äë‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∑ßÂ¶ôÁöÑÊïôËÇ≤ÊµãÈ™åÔºöÂÆÉ‰∏éÊó∂Èó¥ÊúâÂÖ≥„ÄÇ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã745 ‚Äî July 18, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The JavaScript Date Quiz ‚Äî Prepare to get irritated? JavaScript‚Äôs native date parsing features are notoriously arcane and prone to cause surprises if you step off the beaten track. So while we await the broad availability of the Temporal API, why not put your assumptions and knowledge to the test with an educational¬†quiz?

Sam Rose

Next.js 15.4 Released (and What's Coming in Next.js 16) ‚Äî A relatively small release for Next, but with updates to performance, stability, and Turbopack compatibility, and a good summary of what‚Äôs coming next in Next.js¬†16.

Jimmy Lai and Zack Tanner

Add SSO & SCIM with Just a Few Lines of Code ‚Äî WorkOS offers clean, well-documented APIs for SSO, SCIM, RBAC, and more, so you can focus on building features your users care about. Trusted by engineering teams at Cursor, Replit, Vercel, and¬†Temporal.

WorkOS sponsor

WebAssembly: Yes, But for What? ‚Äî Writing for ACM Queue, one of the contributors to multiple JavaScript and WebAssembly (WASM) implementations shares a good roundup of where WebAssembly is being used, both in the browser and server-side, and how it‚Äôs gradually finding its way into seemingly¬†everything.

Andy Wingo / ACM

IN BRIEF:

  • Vue 3.6 Alpha has been released as a preview of what's coming up. Vapor Mode is a key addition for compiling single file¬†components into a more efficient¬†form.

  • React Native is gaining support for Node-API, opening up a lot of possibilities for code-sharing, build optimizations, and bringing existing packages into the React Native¬†ecosystem.

  • The Node.js team is discussing whether to move Node to annual major releases (as opposed to twice a year¬†now).

  • You can now run Laravel (PHP) apps within Node.js.

RELEASES:

  • Nuxt v4.0 ‚Äì A major DX-focused release for the popular full-stack Vue.js¬†framework.

  • Node.js v24.4.1, v22.17.1, and v20.19.4 ‚Äì To fix security¬†vulnerabilities.

  • ESLint v9.31.0 ‚Äì Four core rules have been updated to support explicit resource¬†management.

  • Astro 5.12, Neutralinojs 6.2, OpenPGP.js 6.2

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

How to Create an NPM Package in 2025 ‚Äî One of JavaScript‚Äôs most essential tasks, but one with numerous steps involved if you want to follow best practices, integrate useful tools, and get things just right. Matt Pocock rounds up the overall process¬†here.

Matt Pocock

The History of React Through Code ‚Äî An epic article charting React‚Äôs evolution from its origins at Facebook through to now. It sheds light on React‚Äôs core philosophies and the motivations behind major decisions. This is a great way to round out your thinking about, and knowledge of, React's overall¬†story.

Corbin Crutchley

How to Build an AI Coding Rules App with Lovable ‚Äî Guide AI to generate a secure, full-stack app with minimal prompts‚Äîlearn how to turn ideas into working software¬†fast.

Clerk sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†The Untold Story of JavaScript ‚Äî Two months ago, the Deno team shared A Brief History of JavaScript, a thorough timeline-based tour of JavaScript each year from 1994 till now. This video covers the same ground in just 8¬†minutes.

Deno

A Better Promise.all() ‚Äì Utility Types and Functions ‚Äî Utility types and functions that make deep promise handling more ergonomic and¬†type-safe.

Nick Keuning

üìÑ Make Your Website Talk with the Web Speech API ‚Äì A simple, straightforward¬†approach. Andrew Magill

üìÑ How I Found a Bypass in Google's Big Anti-Adblock Update ‚Äì A neat bit of JavaScript hackery (which is now fixed in¬†Chrome). Derin Eryilmaz

üìÑ Building a 3D Product Configurator with Babylon.js ‚Äì How to take configurable 3D models to the¬†Web. Josh Sanderson

üìÑ Modern Async Iteration with Array.fromAsync() Matt Smith

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Tiptap v3: The Headless Rich Text Editor Framework ‚Äî Tiptap provides a fantastic base for putting together powerful rich text editing experiences, and v3 includes a lot of DX improvements like being able to unmount and remount editors (ideal for dynamic UIs), ‚ÄòMarkviews‚Äô for creating custom views for text segments (marks) using your own components, an SSR mode, and more. GitHub¬†repo.

Tiptap GmbH

‚úâÔ∏è¬†Upyo: A Simple Cross-Runtime Email Sending Library ‚Äî A cross-runtime email library that provides a unified, type-safe API for sending emails both on SMTP and HTTP-based (e.g. SendGrid or Amazon SES) providers. TIL that ‚Äòupyo‚Äô (Ïö∞Ìëú) means ‚Äòpostage stamp‚Äô in¬†Korean.

Hong Minhee

No Breakpoints, No console.log ‚Äî Just AI & Time Travel ‚Äî 15x faster TypeScript and JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, upgrading your AI agent into an expert debugger with real-time¬†context.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Hyper Fetch: A 'Turbocharged' Fetch Library for Working with Remote¬†APIs ‚Äî A framework-agnostic, Axios and TanStack Query-inspired type-safe data-fetching framework for browser and server environments, with request lifecycle management, real-time communication, progress tracking, and codegen for Swagger/OpenAPI. GitHub¬†repo.

Maciej Pyrc et al.

GrowField: Small, Dependency-Free Module for Making Textarea Elements Grow ‚Äî Very simple. For when you‚Äôve got a textarea input and you want it to grow as more content is added to¬†it.

Five Fifteen

  • ESLint Markdown Language Plugin 7.0 ‚Äì Lint Markdown with ESLint, as well JS, JSX, TypeScript, and more inside¬†Markdown.

  • üñäÔ∏è Atrament 5.0 ‚Äì A small JS library for natural-feeling drawing and handwriting on canvas¬†elements.

  • xo 1.2 ‚Äì JavaScript/TypeScript linter (ESLint wrapper) with great¬†defaults.

  • Wasp 0.17 ‚Äì Wasp is a Rails-like framework using Node, React &¬†Prisma.

  • Tinybase 6.4 ‚Äì Powerful reactive data store for local‚Äëfirst¬†apps.

  • express-rate-limit 8.0 ‚Äì Rate-limiting middleware for¬†Express.

  • TWGL.js 7.0 ‚Äì Minimalistic WebGL helper library. (Docs.)

  • Bladewind 3.1 ‚Äì JavaScript UI components for Laravel¬†apps.

  • Concaveman 2.0 ‚Äì A fast 2D concave hull algorithm.

  • MUI X 8.8 ‚Äì Popular React component¬†suite.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

If you're a Node.js developers, don't forget to check out Node Weekly, our sister newsletter where we cover Node more¬†deeply.

üéÅ¬†Tiny Bonus Items

  • üîé git-quick-stats.sh is a shell-based way to get a lot of statistics about your current Git¬†repo.

  • A developer shares his experience of crawling a billion web pages in just 24¬†hours.

  • ü§ñ Burke Holland gives us a first look at GitHub's Copilot Coding Agent, essentially a more stand-alone, independent AI agent you can point at working on issues and PRs in your¬†repo.

  • AWS has unveiled Amazon S3 Vectors, an add-on to its S3 object storage service that lets you store and query vectors.

„Äë

item.title: „ÄêThe details of TC39's last meeting„ÄëTC39‰∏äÊ¨°‰ºöËÆÆÁöÑÁªÜËäÇ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã744 ‚Äî July 11, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Vercel Acquires NuxtLabs ‚Äî Vercel has acquired the company that caretakes the Nuxt project and employs some of its core team ‚Äì a move Vue creator Evan You is quite optimistic about. Vercel now manages, or at least supports, several key projects like Next.js, Turborepo, Svelte, and shadcn/ui. Nuxt itself remains open source and has a promising future. Vercel‚Äôs Guillermo Rauch shares a little more about the move¬†here.

NuxtLabs / Vercel

üí° Daniel Roe, leader of the Nuxt team, answered lots of questions about the acquisition on¬†Reddit.

FlexGrid by Wijmo: The Industry-Leading JavaScript Datagrid ‚Äî A fast and flexible DataGrid for building modern web apps. Key features and virtualized rendering are included in the core grid module. Pick & choose special features to keep your app small. Built for JavaScript, extended to Angular, React, and¬†Vue.

Wijmo From MESCIUS sponsor

A Detailed Summary of the Latest TC39 Plenary ‚Äî A thorough roundup of May‚Äôs major ECMAScript committee meeting with far more detail about each proposal‚Äôs development and the decisions made than we usually get to hear about. Topics include Array.fromAsync, explicit resource management, the Temporal API, and some brainstorming around¬†AsyncContext.

Igalia Compilers Team

IN BRIEF:

  • TypeScript 5.9 Beta has been released with support for deferred module evaluation by using import defer.

  • The Nginx HTTP server has a module (njs) for extending its functionality using JavaScript, but it only supported ES5. Now, njs uses QuickJS for a more modern, powerful experience with full ES2023¬†support.

  • Got some time to kill? There's one week left to submit an entry to the JS1024 annual JavaScript golfing competition. Create a cool JS or GLSL program in under 1024 bytes.

  • Oliver Stenbom reflects on the prevalence of Rust in modern JavaScript ecosystem tooling.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v24.4.0 (Current) ‚Äì Note that new versions of all maintained Node.js releases are due next week due to some security¬†vulnerabilities.

  • Oxlint 1.6 ‚Äì Rust-powered linter for JS and¬†TS.

  • VS Code v1.102, Ember 6.5, Angular 20.1

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

What‚Äôs the Difference Between Ordinary Functions and Arrow Functions? ‚Äî This sounds like basic stuff, but James always does a good job of digging in and explaining things in a way that gives you a more nuanced way to think about a concept, even if it‚Äôs just ‚ÄúWhich function declaration syntax should I¬†use?‚Äù

James Sinclair

üí° His guide to how to compose JS functions that take multiple parameters is also worth¬†revisiting.

Embrace Web RUM Provides User-Focused Observability ‚Äî Get session timelines, Core Web Vitals and JS exceptions in context, and user journey analysis with issue¬†correlation.

Embrace sponsor

JavaScript Scope Hoisting is Broken ‚Äî The creator of Parcel argues that scope hoisting (when bundlers inline modules into a shared scope) conflicts with modern JS patterns like code splitting and dynamic imports, causing subtle bugs and offering little benefit, so he‚Äôs considering removing it in Parcel¬†v3.

Devon Govett

Codepoint‚ÄìSafe Truncation: Fixing Emoji Slicing ‚Äî An app‚Äôs CSV importer kept breaking on emoji-filled rows, triggering errors. James demonstrates how swapping slice for a code-point‚Äìaware spread fixes¬†it.

James Mulholland

üìÑ Parsing 1 Billion Rows in Bun in Under 10 Seconds Tae Kim

üìÑ Loosely Synchronize Your JS Stores in Multiple Tauri Processes ‚Äì Tauri is a bit like a Rust-flavored Electron for building cross-platform native¬†apps. Costa Alexoglou

üìÑ Managing the State of Your Promises ‚Äì On the potential of Promise.all and Promise.allSettled. Lydia Cho

üìÑ When Can I Use Temporal? ‚Äì ‚ÄúIf Brendan Eich can invent .. JavaScript in 10 days, why has it taken eight years to replace the Date¬†API?‚Äù John Dalziel

üìÑ Is It Still Worth Using jQuery in 2025? Suren Enfiajyan

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Driver.js: Tours, Highlights, Contextual Help, and More ‚Äî A vanilla JS library for making on-page tours and contextual help systems. It‚Äôs been around for several years, but is still maintained, and there are lots of examples to check out ‚Äì it‚Äôs really¬†smooth.

Kamran Ahmed

jsonrepair: Repair Invalid JSON Documents ‚Äî This has lots of possible use cases, including dealing with weird JSON coming back from LLMs or non-compliant JSON spat out by poorly built software. You can use it from Node, as a CLI tool, or try a basic version¬†online.

Jos de Jong

ü§° In barely related news, someone has turned JSON into its own programming language. Oh, the¬†horror!

Server-Side Support for MCP in Next.js ‚Äî Server-side MCP just got easier in Next.js. One route, no extra infra‚ÄîScorecard cut 1,000 lines to just¬†70.

Clerk sponsor

line-numbers: A Web Component to Add Line Numbers Next to Various HTML Elements ‚Äî Useful for custom apps that show source code or other snippets that require line numbering. See examples here, which demonstrate the flexibility customization options for the line¬†numbering.

Zach Leatherman

cRonstrue 3.0: Convert Cron Expressions into Natural Language ‚Äî Not just English either - it supports about thirty locales. There‚Äôs also an online¬†demo.

Brady Holt

  • Next.js Boilerplate 5.0 ‚Äì Boilerplate starter app for Next.js with auth, database support, i18n, forms, and¬†more.

  • üîé React Scan 0.4 ‚Äì Scan for performance issues and eliminate slow renders in your¬†app.

  • üéπ html-midi-player 1.6 ‚Äì Play and display MIDI files on the web.

  • CKEditor5 46.0 ‚Äì Popular commercial rich text editor framework.

  • üìä Recharts 3.1 ‚Äì D3-powered chart library for¬†React.

  • Vuetify 3.9 ‚Äì Vue component¬†framework.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üìå Try out PinMe: free CLI tool helps deploy your static site in seconds‚Äîand keeps it online without any ongoing cost or¬†maintenance.

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere...

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem this week:

  • As of Chrome 137, you can try out CSS inline conditionals using the new if() function.

  • Did you know you can generate efficient SVGs that feel like GIFs and even use them in your GitHub README.md files?

  • On Reddit, an ex-Meta engineer posted an interesting comment about how Meta / Facebook serves up React as part of the main Facebook¬†site.

  • PlanetScale has shared a neat interactive article about caching that visually demonstrates the benefits of caching from several different angles, right down to the CPU level.

  • ùïè Claude Code is now a single-file executable thanks to Bun.

item.title: „ÄêWill WebAssembly ever get DOM support?„ÄëWebAssembly‰ºöËé∑ÂæóDOMÊîØÊåÅÂêóÔºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã746 ‚Äî July 25, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

es-toolkit: A Modern JavaScript Utility Library ‚Äî Boasts being both faster and ‚Äò97% smaller‚Äô than the ubiquitous Lodash, for which it is a direct 'seamless' replacement (and now boasting 100% Lodash compatibility). The reference guide shows off all it can do, and it‚Äôs widely adopted ‚Äî being used by Storybook, CKEditor, and recommended by Nuxt. GitHub¬†repo.

Viva Republica, Inc

Avoid Common Mistakes in React and Next.js ‚Äî Avoid redundant useState and useEffect, deeply nested data, unscalable forms, and hidden shared state bugs. David Khourshid teaches practical patterns to refactor complex apps and scale with¬†confidence!

Frontend Masters sponsor

When is WebAssembly Going to Get DOM Support? ‚Äî Working with the DOM from JavaScript is straightforward, but WebAssembly requires glue code to do it. Is this going to change? Daniel of the TC39 committee digs into the issue here and says that modern build toolchains and WASM‚Äôs evolution are making things easier all the¬†time.

Daniel Ehrenberg

IN BRIEF:

  • Over on X, Feross Aboukhadijeh explains a major supply chain breach in the JS ecosystem where popular packages, including is, were hijacked to ship¬†malware. Here's an article on the specifics, if you'd¬†prefer.

  • npm took down the stylus package for a while, due to security issues, which caused quite a few problems.. this is a rather extensive story.

  • üá™üá∏ ¬øHablas espa√±ol? EsJS is a strikingly well-presented experiment ‚Äì complete with online playground ‚Äì to let you write JavaScript in¬†Spanish.

  • A comparison of Biome and Oxlint when it comes to offering fast, type-aware linting¬†rules.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.2.19 ‚Äì The fast JS runtime now supports pnpm-style isolated node_modules with bun install, offers an interactive dependency updating feature, and more. Bun 1.3 is also expected very¬†soon.

  • PythonMonkey 1.2 ‚Äì Embed the SpiderMonkey JS engine into Python's¬†VM.

  • React Native Reanimated 4.0 ‚Äì React Native's Animated¬†reimplemented.

  • Oxlint 1.8, Jasmine 5.9

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

A JS 'Numbers Station' in 1 Kilobyte ‚Äî We‚Äôve recently promoted the js1024 JavaScript code golfing contest ‚Äì it‚Äôs now over, but Terence breaks down his interesting entry which recreates the vibe of real-life numbers¬†stations.

Terence Eden

üí° You can also look through all the other js1024 submissions.

Revisiting My 2010 JavaScript Library ‚Äî A developer looks back at code he wrote 15 years ago, the ‚Äòclever solutions‚Äô he used, and why most of it is redundant in¬†2025.

Ibrahim Diallo

Build an MCP Server in Your Next.js Application with Clerk ‚Äî Add a spec-compliant MCP endpoint in minutes, allowing LLMs to access user data with user¬†consent.

Clerk sponsor
